structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.catch_line: Cost of physical examination required for employment of classified personnel.

text.section: When a physical examination is required as a condition of employment of classified personnel, excluding bus drivers, the examination shall be provided at no cost to the employee by the board. The examination shall be provided by the county health department if appropriate health department personnel are available.
If employee elects to be examined by private physician, the cost of examination shall be borne by employee.

Each examination shall include a risk assessment and the appropriate follow-up with skin testing or chest X-ray for applicants who are determined to be at risk for developing tuberculosis in accordance with the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The risk assessment and the appropriate follow-up for those determined to be at risk shall be conducted prior to August 1 of the employable year in which the person is employed.

law.history: Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 144, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2008. -- Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 475, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 70, sec. 1, effective March 20, 1980.
